awd_titl_txt: U.S.-Brazil Cooperative Research on Nonlinear Waves in      Cardiography and in Petroleum Reservoir Engineering
awd_abstract_narration: 9512873  Plohr    This U.S.-Brazil collaborative research project will develop  mathematical models and techniques to study the propagation  and noninvasive magnetic detection of electrochemical waves  in cardiac tissue and also develop the theory of fundamental  solutions of three-phase flow in petroleum reservoirs.  Led  by Bradley Plohr of SUNY Stony Brook and Dan Marchesin of  Instituto de Matematica Pura e Aplicada (IMPA) in Brazil, a  group of 6 to 10 U.S. scientists and as many Brazilian  scientists will collaborate on these problems.  Several  graduate students in each country will also be involved in  the endeavor.      The project is both international and interdisciplinary,  bringing together mathematicians, physicists, doctors, and  engineers in two countries.  Building on established  collaborations, new avenues of research including new  investigators will be opened.  An established emphasis on  development of graduate students will also be continued.      ***
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
